summary: REQ-61 share link behavior appears implemented across Settings plus (per file summaries) TopNav mobile menu and Footer using a shared Web Share API + clipboard fallback utility with English feedback. REQ-62 adds backend APK URL getters/setters and Settings integration, plus an admin configuration page/route. Events are wired end-to-end (hooks, public Events page, admin manager), but backend Events schema and persistence do not meet REQ-63 minimum fields and stable storage requirements, and the public Events page does not render the required event "type" field.

missing_requirements.requirement: If the APK URL is not set, Settings shows an English message such as "Android APK is not available yet. Please check back later."
missing_requirements.reason: SettingsSheet.tsx shows fetching apkUrl and a handler to open it, but the provided diff snippet does not show any explicit empty-state message when apkUrl is unset.

missing_requirements.requirement: Backend defines an Event record type with a unique id and fields sufficient to render the current Events page content (title, date, time, location, description, type at minimum).
missing_requirements.reason: The backend Event type includes id/title/description/dateTime/location/media/organizer, but no explicit "type" field, and date/time are not represented as separate fields (only a combined dateTime).

missing_requirements.requirement: Events data persists in stable storage across upgrades (using conditional migration if required by the current stable state).
missing_requirements.reason: eventsMap is declared as a non-stable `let` map in backend/main.mo, and no stable variable is shown for events storage; therefore events would not persist across upgrades based on the diff snippet. A migration file is added, but main.mo does not show eventsMap being stored in stable state.

missing_requirements.requirement: For each event, the page renders title, description, date, time, location, and type.
missing_requirements.reason: EventsPage.tsx renders title, description, date, time (parsed from dateTime), location, and organizer badge, but no "type" field is shown in the snippet.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a dedicated admin page and route for configuring the Android APK URL (/me/android-apk).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-62 requires an admin-configurable APK URL and Settings exposure for users, but does not explicitly require a new admin UI page/route to manage it.

hallucinated_features.description: Added a backend query to fetch a single event by id (getEvent).
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-63 only calls for a public query to list events plus admin-only create/update/delete; a single-event query is extra.

hallucinated_features.description: Added an "Admin Login" button on the public Membership Registration page.
hallucinated_features.reason: No requirement requests changes to the membership registration page or adding an admin login shortcut there.
